definition: conceived or made without regard for reason or reality
sentences: *Absurd* claims of having been abducted by UFO's.

definition: showing or marked by a lack of good sense or judgement
sentences: An *absurd* rule that bicycles are not allowed in the park.

definition: a state of great suffering of body or mind
sentences: As a new teacher, she was in real *anguish* over the decision to report the cheating.

definition: deep sadness especially for the loss of someone or something loved
sentences: Words can't express my *anguish* at losing my cat.

definition: to cause persistent suffering to
sentences: She was *anguished* by the fear that her sons would die in the war.

definition: to feel deep sadness or mental pain
sentences: I *anguished* over the loss of my father for years afterwards.

definition: an assert that brings praise or renown
sentences: The school's *boast* was a winning football team.

definition: to praise or express pride in one's own possessions, qualities, or accomplishments often to excess
sentences: He *boasted* about his latest killing in real estate so I thought he should be the one to pay for dinner.

definition: to have within
sentences: The hotel *boasts* nearly 50 rooms.

definition: to move suddenly and sharply (as in surprise)
sentences: I *bolted* as I read the winning lottery numbers.

definition: to proceed or move quickly
sentences: The cat *bolted* for the food dish the minute he spied it.

definition: to hasten away from something dangerous or frightening
sentences: The rabbit *bolted* when it saw the fox approaching.

definition: to utter with a sudden burst of strong feeling
sentences: *Bolted* out the cuss word without thinking.

definition: to swallow or eat greedily
sentences: The way you *bolted*  those hot dogs, it's no wonder you're feeling a little queasy.

definition: having much high-spirited energy and movement
sentences: A *brisk* exercise that many athletes use to warm up.

definition: moving, proceeding, or acting with great speed
sentences: Moved at a *brisk* walk through the exhibit.

definition: marked by much life, movement, or activity
sentences: *Brisk* trading on the stock market.

definition: an organized group of singers
sentences: Brad joined the *choir* for next year.

definition: to sing or sound in chorus
sentences: He *choirs* then sang the national air of "God save the King."

definition: to cause (a person) to give in to pressure
sentences: Public opinion *compelled* her to fire her scandal-plagued aide.

definition: facial appearance regarded as an indication of mood or feeling
sentences: A pleasant *countenance* that puts visitors at ease.

definition: to have a favorable opinion of
sentences: I don't *countenance* such behavior in children of any age.

definition: to bring destruction to (something) through violent action
sentences: The city was *devastated*, first by the earthquake and then by fires.

definition: to bring to a complete end the physical soundness, existence, or usefulness of
sentences: The explosion *devastated* an entire city block.

definition: to subject to incapacitating emotional or mental stress
sentences: We were *devastated* by the awful news of his death.

definition: having or showing a lack of interest or concern
sentences: The city's philistines, naturally *disinterested* in art, voted to cut the museum's budget.

definition: marked by justice, honesty, and freedom from bias.
sentences: A judge who is widely respected for his *disinterested* decisions.

definition: having a liking or affection
sentences: Even lots of city people are *fond* of country music.

definition: feeling or showing love
sentences: Gave me a *fond* embrace upon parting.

definition: granted special treatment or attention
sentences: My *fondest* wish is to see my children marry well.

definition: a state of being aware
sentences: Took *heed* of the student's learning disability so as to arrive at reasonable expectations for him.

definition: strict attentiveness to what one is doing
sentences: Pay *heed* to what you're doing with that knife while you're talking.

definition: to take notice of and be guided by
sentences: If we had *heeded* the ranger's advice, we might not have gotten lost.

definition: to pay attention especially through the act of hearing
sentences: That boy never *heeds* when I caution him about running with his shoelaces untied.

definition: to be the business or affair of
sentences: This isn't something that *involves* you, so don't worry about it.

definition: to have as part of a whole
sentences: A tragic play usually *involves* a number of plot devices, including the hero's fatal flaw.

definition: to hold the attention of
sentences: Her blissful daydream so completely *involved* her that she never heard the knock on the door.

definition: to surround or cover closely
sentences: A mind that was deeply *involved* in doubt about his wife's fidelity.

definition: having a noticeably small amount of body fat
sentences: All of the marathoners are extremely *lean*.

definition: the degree to which something rises up from a position level with the horizon
sentences: The wall has enough of a *lean* that we can't set a bookcase against it.

definition: to set or cause to be at an angle
sentences: Just *lean* the ladder against the tree and climb up it.

definition: to show a liking or proneness (for something)
sentences: The family's diet *leans* toward greasy food.

definition: to place reliance or trust
sentences: You can always *lean* on me if you need help.

definition: being in a situation where one is likely to meet with harm
sentences: Because of his frail constitution, he's *liable* to diseases.

definition: being the one who must meet an obligation or suffer the consequences for failing to do so
sentences: The owner of a pet is *liable* for any damage that that pet might do.

definition: a small uneven mass
sentences: She dumped a *lump* of clay on the table and started to sculpt.

definition: a small rounded mass of swollen tissue
sentences: I got a good-sized *lump* on my head from that fall.

definition: an abnormal mass of tissue
sentences: Advised by her doctor to examine her breasts regularly for unusual *lumps*.

definition: to bring together in one body or place
sentences: When we *lumped* all of our pocket change together, we found that we had just enough a buy a carton of ice cream.

definition: something extraordinary or surprising
sentences: That new electric car really is a *marvel*.

definition: being about midway between extremes of amount of size
sentences: He was awarded a *modest* pension when he retired.

definition: not having or showing any feelings of superiority, self-assertiveness, or showiness
sentences: She is appealingly *modest* about her success in the fashion industry.

definition: a person's solemn declaration that he or she will do or do not do something
sentences: I need your *oath* that you won't do anything until I've had time to make a decision.

definition: the following of a custom, rule, or law
sentences: The *observance* of this family trandition would make your grandmother very happy.

definition: an oft-repeated action of series of actions performed in accordance with tradition or a set of rules
sentences: Some religions require very specific *observances* on holy days.

definition: a usually wooden implement that has a long handle and a broad flattened blade and that is used to propel and steer a small craft.
sentences: The flow of the river was powerful and fast, so I had to *paddle* hard.

definition: to move a boat by means of oars
sentences: I like to *paddle* on the river for exercise and relaxation.

definition: to strike repeatedly
sentences: Back in those times it was acceptable for teachers to *paddle* misbehaving students.

definition: to present a false appearance of
sentences: *Professed* friendship while secretly plotting revenge.

definition: to state clearly and strongly
sentences: The lonely woman *professed* her love in a series of letters to the soldier.

definition: to state as a fact usually forcefully
sentences: He *professed* his innocence to anyone who would listen.

definition: to drive back
sentences: The defenders *repelled* the attacking army after several hours of fierce fighting.

definition: to refuse to give in to
sentences: *Repelled* the temptation to stay out late and call in sick the next day.

definition: being the one who must meet an obligation or suffer the consequences for failing to do so
sentences: The state laws hold pet owners *responsible* for any damage or injury done by improperly restrained animals.

definition: worthy of one's trust
sentences: Our regular babysitter is very *responsible*.

definition: a clever often underhanded means to achieve an end
sentences: An e-mail *shceme* to trick unwary Internet users into disclosing passwords and financial information.

definition: a secret plan for accomplishing evil or unlawful ends
sentences: A *scheme* to kidnap the president's daughter.

definition: a method worked out in advance for achieving some objective
sentences: A *scheme* to upgrade the city's mass transit system.

definition: to engage in a secret plan to accomplish evil or unlawful end
sentences: The town inspector had *schemed* to overlook the contractor's code violations in exchange for a substantial bribe.

definition: to criticize (someone) severely or angrily especially for personal failings
sentences: He *scolded* the kids for not cleaning up the mess they had made in the kitchen.

definition: to make more pleasant to the taste by adding something intensely flavored
sentences: The chef *seasoned* the vegetables as soon as they came out of the oven

definition: a structure that holds up or serves as a foundation for something else
sentences: The carpenter placed a *shore* underneath the sagging roof of the porch.

definition: the area or space occupied by or intended for something
sentences: This field is the intended *site* for a new shopping mall.

definition: causing or characterized by the one of the four basic taste sentations that is produced chiefly by acids
sentences: The *sour* candy made our mouths all wrinkly inside.

definition: not giving pleasure to the mind or senses
sentences: You'll have to face up to the *sour* truth of the matter.

definition: falling short of a standard
sentences: Things started off well, but now it's all gone *sour*.

definition: to cause to change from friendly or loving to unfriendly or uncaring
sentences: A misunderstanding that *soured* their relationship for a long time.

definition: valuables stolen or taken by force
sentences: The bandits escaped with their lives but not with the *spoils".

definition: something that arouses action or activity
sentences: The threat of losing its only sports franchise was the *spur* the city council needed to finally do something about the rising crime rate.

definition: a structure that holds up or serves as a foundation for something else
sentences: A weak wall that might need a *spur*.

definition: to urge or push forward with or as if with a pointed object
sentences: He gently *spurred* the horse with his heels.

definition: basic or main, standard or regular
sentences: The summer *staple* item this year is any garment that is off the shoulder.;Her latest film is the *staple* offering of action and comedy that we have come to expect.

definition: the main or greater part of something as distinguished from its subordinate parts
sentences: Reading is the very *staple* of a person's education.

definition: an instrument for determining temperature
sentences: The liquid-in-glass *thermometer* was the first true temperature measuring instrument.

definition: a successful result brought about by hard work
sentences: Getting into Harvard is quite a *triumph*.

definition: an instance of defeating an enemy or opponent
sentences: Our stunning *triumph* on the field won us the title of regional champs.

definition: to achieve victory (as in a contest)
sentences: Despite an accident early on, the runner persevered and ultimately *triumphed*.

definition: to feel or express joy or triumph
sentences: In that part of the world it's customary for people to *triumph* by firing guns into the air.

definition: having or showing a lack of interest or concern
sentences: The teacher decided to make a career change after having to teach yet another class of *uninterested* teens.

definition: to continue to declare to be true or proper despite opposition or objections
sentences: Determined to *uphold* her views in the face of all chanllenges.

definition: to hold up or serve as a foundation for
sentences: An entablature *upheld* by a series of gracefully slender columns.

definition: to move from a lower to a higher place or position
sentences: Worshippers *upheld* their joined hands and sang the praises of the Lord.
